snippet: The Justice Department is examining new evidence to find out if the medical devices manufacturer helped bribe government officials in Mexico and Brazil.
abstract: Biomet discloses Justice Department will extend its probation for another year as it investigates whether company bribed government officials in Mexico and Brazil; inquiry is painful reminder of bribery case that Biomet settled in 2012, leading to initial three-year probation; new charges could endanger company's proposed $13.5 billion merger with rival Zimmer Holdings.
lead_paragraph: The Justice Department is examining new evidence to find out if the medical devices manufacturer helped bribe government officials in Mexico and Brazil.

headline.main: New Bribery Evidence Adds a Year to Biomet’s Probation
headline.print_headline: New Bribery Evidence Adds a Year to Biomet’s Probation
